definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: I want to attend a speed-up course class to improve my computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 我想参加一个速成班来提高我的电脑水平。

sentences.english: A: Do you think it will help?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得速成班会有帮助吗？

sentences.english: A crash course in color theory will go a long way.
sentences.chinese: 在色彩理论上个速成班对你大有裨益。

sentences.english: I took a crash course in skiing before going on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 度假前我参加了一个滑雪速成班。

sentences.english: He finished in two years and by the time he was 22 had completed medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他在两年后念完了速成班，22岁从医学院毕业。

sentences.english: I did a 15-week crash course in typing.
sentences.chinese: 我上了一个15周的打字速成班。

sentences.english: He will get a crash course in French.
sentences.chinese: 他要去参加一个法语速成班。

sentences.english: But I’m taking this crash course in math.
sentences.chinese: 但是我正在上数学速成班。

definition: crash (course)/accelerated (process)/quick (fix)/instant (success)/to achieve in a short time
school begins/give a course/teach a subject
student/member of an institution of learning/officer cadet
to teach face to face/to instruct in person
to immediately put into practice something one has just learned (idiom)
